definition: to be willing to part with sth
residence
old variant of 捨|舍[she3]
surname She
to give up/to abandon/to give alms
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
one who does not fear the death of thousand cuts will dare to unhorse the emperor (proverb)/to a fearless person, no fence is high enough
pinyin: she3 de5 yi1 shen1 gua3 , gan3 ba3 huang2 di4 la1 xia4 ma3
containing_words.word: 舍得一身剐，敢把皇帝拉下马

sentences.english: I am a bit too, and habits of the things is not willing to lose.
sentences.chinese: 我就是太念旧，习惯的东西不舍得丢。

sentences.english: I like the idea of working for a company that invests in its staff.
sentences.chinese: 我愿意在舍得在员工身上投资的公司工作。

sentences.english: She likes things, he also buy expensive.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢的东西，再贵他也舍得买。

sentences.english: Since love so long how can you break up go.
sentences.chinese: 既然爱了那么久你怎么舍得分手说走就走。
舍得花钱去筹到更多的资金。

sentences.english: Creative alligator shaped bread sculpture is too cool to eat.
sentences.chinese: 大块面包做成的鳄鱼造型，太酷了，谁还舍得吃涅？

sentences.english: "He is getting decidedly wild," said his grandfather.
sentences.chinese: “老实说，”那位外祖父说，“他真舍得干。”

sentences.english: All the while I was wondering why he had parted with his precious guineas.
sentences.chinese: 我一直弄不懂他为什么会舍得放弃他那些宝贵的金币。
赛拉斯才舍得吃一顿烤肉。

sentences.english: He grudged his cat the food it ate.
sentences.chinese: 他不舍得给他的猫吃食物。

sentences.english: She decided to give it a try before spending that much money.
sentences.chinese: 有不花钱的法子，罗还舍得花许多钱哉。

sentences.english: Dial my heart how people are willing to forget.
sentences.chinese: 拨乱我心跳的人怎么舍得忘记。

sentences.english: Too few of us spend any time outside watching the day go by.
sentences.chinese: 我们中间舍得花时间在外面闲看天的人太少太少了。

sentences.english: I was so NianJiu, accustomed to things not willing to lose.
sentences.chinese: 我就是太念旧，习惯的东西不舍得丢。

sentences.english: Are you willing to give up to let my male color show other women?
sentences.chinese: 你舍得让我的男色让其他女人看到吗？

sentences.english: Wear and love your jewelry and don’t save it for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 要舍得戴首饰并爱惜它们，不要等到特殊场合才戴。

definition: to hate to do sth/to hate to part with/to begrudge
old variant of 肯[ken3]
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
stingy/mean/miserly
to wish/to want/ready/willing (to do sth)
would rather/better
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
hard-earned capital
to have the heart to do sth/to steel oneself to a task
to think through/to invest effort in thinking about/to consider thoroughly
would rather.../it would be better.../would prefer
to spend money
to care about/equivalent of 在於|在于[zai4 yu2]
dynastic records of imperial China
to let go one's hold/to give up/to have a free hand
preferably/one would prefer to...(or not to...)/would rather/(would) be better to/(to pick) the lesser of two evils
unworthy
